Message.Title: re: prayers at Dem convention...
Message.Msg: ... “The Obama administration announced that it would be hosting Isl#mic “Jumah” prayers for two hours on the Friday of its Democratic National convention, after denying a Catholic cardinal’s request to say a prayer at the same event.” How disgustingly pathetic that you have nothing better to support your perverted views of America than to consistently make up complete racist nonsense to stimulate your base. Worse yet, is that the people you are shining on with this BS, are so ignorantly gullible as to believe stuff like this: “So conservatives are racists, extremists, and every bad thing in the book because we want to preserve the Constitution and not depend on the big government to save us. Yet, here we have the liberals outright denying a cardinal and instead allowing two clearly anti-American M#slims to usher in the DNC. Sad...” – Patriot Action Network “It is troubling that the Democratic National Convention has decided to promote and lend its name and national political platform to the organizers of the Jummah at the DNC?. The leaders of this event...are no moderates. They are radicals.” - RedState “Is it fair to say Democrats are embracing radicals at their upcoming national convention? It seems more than fair to say it, based upon the evidence.” – Breibart So are all you fear mongering birthers delighted with this nonsense? Anybody want the truth? This story is... FALSE!!! http://www.snopes.com/politics/religion/dncprayer.asp Cardinal Dolan had not been refused. Since being contacted by the DNC he is giving the closing prayer at the Dems convention, just as he is for the GOP. The Jumah event, starting four days before the Democratic Convention is an independent, non-convention community event. It is neither sponsored by the DNC nor a part of the official convention schedule. There were 1200 non-official events at the Dems’ convention in ’08 in Denver, and about 1000 scheduled for Charlotte. The Jumah event is one of them. BFD. If you look at the schedule of events, you’ll see that the events scheduled for Charlotte are “all-inclusive,” which is indicative of the party’s egalitarian platform representing all Americans – unlike the supercilious views of those in Tampa. It’s interesting to note the apparent lack of confidence in their vision that would require them to consistently spread malevolence through lies and deception to thoughtless, fearful individuals.

Topic.Title: regarding Yahoo's new message boards

Message.Msg: I have seen the new format on a couple of stocks but not yet on T. On the bottom of the screen they tell you it is a new format and if you click on it there is a space for comments. Whether yahoo actually reads them is another story.... Other issues with the new format, when you ignore a user the posts sort of show up in order with "comment hidden." I don't even want to know the person I am ignoring is posting. So far the changes are not very impressive.

Topic.Title: Obama standards will double car prices

The electric vehicles do not meet the needs of our driving habits and are very expensive to maintain. Production of the VOLT has stopped because it is not a economically viable. This is probably not going to change during the time constraints outlined by Obama. 3k no way

Message.Title: Beasts of the Southern Wild
Message.Msg: ... With tragedy once again striking the Bayou, I again encourage you to see the film, “Beasts of the Southern Wild.” This is a remarkable film, acclaimed at both Cannes and Sundance. “(the film) winks at skepticism, laughs at sober analysis and stares down criticism.” – N.Y. Times “After all, we consume art to see the world from a new perspective.” – The Atlantic “No thanks, we’re projecting “2016” on a sheet on a wall outside the Wizard’s garage tonight – Most of the Knights think it’s “Birth of a Nation” but they won’t know the difference – they’re really here for the free beer, anyhow!” – Lavender “Sorry :-)I’ve already rented “S#x Lives of the Potato Men” for tonight. Mmmmm, I’ve seen it, like nine times. It’s so-o-o-o-o- funny (grins, giggle, tee-hee)” – jon “Oh, yeah, don’t believe the MSM reviews: “This is one of the two most nauseating films ever made – a seedy medley of sketches – a master class in filmmaking ineptitude” – N.Y. Times Here’s the trailer for “Beasts.” Like the storm - powerful: http://www.beastsofthesouthernwild.com/
